intro: Psychotria huallagae, commonly known as the Huallaga Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Peru and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical rainforests. Psychotria huallagae is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical significance due to its association with traditional use in certain indigenous communities.
